Pre-Game Insights: One more win for India in the ODI World Cup 2023 will secure them a place in the semi-final, which will be an added motivation for them to perform well against Sri Lanka on November 2.

India are firm favourites to win against Sri Lanka, on the basis of the recent run of results, in their next match of the ODI World Cup 2023, but still, they canâ€™t afford to take the former world champions lightly on November 2.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitches at the Wankhede Stadium for the ODI World Cup 2023 have been one of the best for batters, where a lot of big totals have been made consistently.
The Indian cricket team could easily breach the average first innings score at this venue, on the evidence of the current form of their batters, against Sri Lanka in their upcoming encounter.
Others: Rohit Sharma played an impressive innings of 87, curbing his natural instincts to play attacking cricket, to resurrect the Indian batting lineup, who had lost three quick wickets against England in their last outing of the ODI World Cup 2023.
The Indian bowlers had only 229 runs to defend, they did it at a canter, with the likes of Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Shami, and Kuldeep Yadav picking up the bag of wickets of the English.

Sri Lanka batters had a tough time with the bat against Afghanistan, losing wickets at regular intervals, with no batters going past the fifties, including the in-form Pathum Nissanka, captain Kusal Mendis, and Sadeera Samarawickrama.
The bowling attack of Sri Lanka also lacked penetration while defending the 241 total, with only Dilshan Madushanka picking up a couple of wickets.
